data.title: Gourmet Foodie Haven in Boise!!!
data.text:
I've come to Boise a couple times each year for family related issues and this is my favorite eatery!! I live in California so sometimes i can be a foodie snob but this place has never failed me!! lol
  Great food, great ambience ,great staff!!
This place is a gourmet foodie heaven with great salads,pastas,paninis and desserts!
I love the staff and they're always so excited to see me again!! 
  BOISE YOU'RE LUCKY TO HAVE A PLACE LIKE THIS ,DON'T MISS OUT!

data.title: Retirement Party
data.text:
Our company hosted a retirement party here. 
The appetizers were just ok.
The dinner was delicious, a peach green salad, salmon, a great pasta, and sliced flank steak. All was served cold, but it was very good. 
I will definitely go back and try their breakfast and lunch.
Very nice gourmet kitchen shop also.

data.title: Dessert!
data.text: I went to a Tavola for a friend's birthday and am already excited to go back. Two of us had the Croque Monsieur, which was so decadently delicious, and our other friend had the salad sampler. She was really happy with the choices, and there were so many options to choose from. It was a tough decision to pick the Croque Monsieur as there were tons of choices, and I'm so happy I chose that. I also had the blackberry mint lemonade and wow was that good. And of course we saved room for dessert! I had a chocolate cupcake with salted caramel frosting and it pained me to share with my friends. They each had the flourless chocolate bites and those were delicious as well. We've decided this will most definitely be our birthday lunch spot! I went back the next day to get my sister a blackberry lemon bar as she couldn't join us, and she loved it!

data.title: Something for everyone
data.text: This is one of my "go to" lunch spots to meet friends in west downtown Boise. My favorite lunch choice is the three salad sampler however their sandwiches are delicious and large portioned.  It is fun to shop the boutique before or after dining.  My only "complaint" about this spot is I am often cold and need a sweater and the dining room is on the loud side.  Sometimes it is a tad confusing as to purchase things but the staff is helpful

data.title: Charming cafe with great food and a lovely shop
data.text: I try to come to A Tavola on each trip to Boise. The food is very good and fresh. The bakery always tempts me with its beautiful sweets and there is always something to take home from the shop. In fact, the shop is the place to come for hostess gifts. You can dine outside under umbrellas, or there is ample seating inside. You should plan to visit soon,and it will be your new favorite place.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: We ate breakfast there on a Thursday and it was so good we went back on Friday.  The restaurant staff was very friendly and helpful and the food was delicious.  On our next trip to Boise, we'll definitely go back to this restaurant.

data.title: Nice brunch and bakery stop
data.text: We stumbled upon this place when we drove through town and we were lucky we did. It looks like they renovated a former tire shop but I'm not sure what it was, anyway they've done a splendid job of it, you wouldn't know what it was except for the big rollup doors. It's open, bright and airy, half gourmet deli and half bakery. The outdoor seating doubles the capacity of the place, maybe more, and it's lovely with a lot of fresh garden boxes sprinkled throughout the space. We had the mushroom scramble and cappuccino and it was excellent. Breakfast and lunch are their specialties. We will be back when in Boise.

data.title: Great Food - Cramped Indoor Seating --Better when outdoor dining opens
data.text:
First regarding the seating, please view the photo's.  They are accurate.   

The food is outstanding as well as the service. You can pick your meal from display cases or they will prepare it from a requested menu option.   They have a very wide variety of selections.   Their online menu is informative.     

My wife had a huge sandwich. I chose a very traditional breakfast.  They were as good as we heard they would be. 

The location is quite eclectic.  There is a wide selection of items for sale in between the dining areas.  You can have fun browsing.      Outdoor seating is blessedly available in season.   

Parking is a challenge.  But, We found on street parking quite easily.

data.title: Gormet selections, yet affordable
data.text:
This is a perfect stop for the creative culinary types with refined tastes. Their bakery offers an excellent array of goodies. Their deli is adjacent to a culinary library which encourages browsing. 

They have a wide variety of delicious goods for sale.

Classy place without ridiculous prices!

data.title: Feels like Dean and Deluca
data.text: Always love going into a Tavola! It feels to me like a smaller Dean and Deluca. Specialty kitchen items and hand made sandwiches, cheeses, jams and everything else. Their coffee bar is also awesome. Because it is on the more expensive side, I always LOVE when my husband takes me here as a treat date lunch. -They also have a great outdoor area in the spring summer and fall.

data.title: Conflicted...
data.text: Some things here are just fantastic-the salads (faves=avacado chicken salad and green olive chicken salad, breakfast enchiladas) are great in general.  The atmosphere is a pastiche of white bourgeois, though, a certain kind of "taste" that has little real soul. The coffee has been consistently unsatisfactory, and requests to enhance a $5 latte so it has a *coffee* flavor met with rudeness and the demand to pay more for that. Still and all, the food is good. The coffee is weak and overpriced at best, en mi opinion.

data.title: Not Bicycle Friendly
data.text: If you like to ride your bicycle to lunch, go somewhere else or run the risk of flat tires.  This place ignores customer comments about their landscaping.  It is difficult to trust a place that neglects to water the planters outside their door, nor pulls the goat head thorn vines (often referred to as puncture vine or Tribulus terrestris).  Numerous other weeds invade the landscaping around the large parking area.  If the care for their landscaping is representative of their food, then be suspicious.  As for the food, it is a decent deli and bakery.  You will get a better sandwich and cookie at Bleubird or the Boise Co-Op, but lunch can still be good.  Everything I have ever eaten at a Tavola is high in salt but that makes for a tasty dish if you crave salt.  The prices are a bit high, but not outrageous.  The water tanks often have cucumbers, strawberries, or lemons in them which is a very nice touch.

data.title: Another winner!
data.text: I believe that Boise is the fantastic breakfast capital of the world.  There's one place after another and her is another great one.  Fresh omelettes, deli food, gourmet pAstries, sandwiches and salads.  So much to chose from presented in a gourmet food shop/ cafe type atmosphere . Set in a rehabbed garage it definitely has atmosphere as well as friendly staff.

data.title: Great place for lunch!!!!
data.text:
Met a buddy for lunch-yuuummmmy!!! We both had the chicken ceasar salad-delicious!!!!! A lil bit pricey but, worth it!!!! 
I would definately recommend it & will go back!!!

data.title: Espresso drinks were very good -- can't wait to try the food!
data.text:
While looking for a parking spot for the Boise Farmers Market, we passed A Tavola and decided to stop there and have coffee. We tried a decaf latte and a decaf cappuccino, which were both very good. We enjoyed our drinks outside on their patio, which was very open with plenty of tables. However, we were very impressed by the quantity of prepared dishes behind the glass cases! I can't wait to return to try some of those yummy-looking dishes. 

A Tavola also has prepared foods, kitchen items and gifts. It's definitely worth a stroll through A Tavola if you are in the area.

data.title: Great desert
data.text: Past by a few times. And we decided to try it. Love the ambient and the products they have. We had two deserts and they we're delicious and fresh

data.title: Great food , a little less than on the service
data.text:
We stopped for lunch and tried a little bit of 8 different salads. They all had good flavor. The whiskey pecan bar for dessert was super yummy like pecan pie, the lemon bar was fresh and homemade with quality ingredients. 
It would be a top notch rating if they allowed plug ins. 
Sadly they don't allow you to plug in your electronics and almost lost my business as a result before I ever tried them.

data.title: Boutique Eatery
data.text: This place is a delightful shop for hard to find kitchen gadgets and carry out delicacies, as well as a place to order lunch and enjoy it in a unique downtown atmosphere.

data.title: Great salads!
data.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Boise! The salads are so delicious. Everything they serve is fresh and so yummy. The people who work there are so helpful and friendly.

data.title: Unexpected!
data.text: Wow! Did not expect to walk into such a great place. I loved the feel of the place and the fun retail items. I had the breakfast panini with fresh squeezed orange juice. Thoroughly enjoyed a leisurely breakfast with my girlfriends. This is a great addition to the Linen District.
